alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 05 at 5:03AM PDT until April 05 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 2500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches along the crest of the Cascades. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
